item.title: By: Eli Weinstock-Herman (tarwn)
item.dc:creator: Eli Weinstock-Herman (tarwn)
item.description: For me, the technical screen is a tool to help identify whether the candidate meets a low technical bar. I try not to assume that not meeting that bar is a result of them being a "bad apple" because it could also just as easily be due to misplaced enthusiasm about their own skill level or because they are actually fairly senior but felt that a simple technical problem required a full enterprise architecture or, the opposite, didn't require a readable answer.

item.title: By: Beverly Thornton
item.dc:creator: Beverly Thornton
item.description: The Technical Screen has basically become an industry in it's own right, with <a href="http://www.testdome.com/" rel="nofollow">coding test platforms like TestDome</a> popping up. Which is not a bad thing. It makes it easier to filter out the bad apples. It just goes to show how important this step is.
